title: Computer Science Foundational Projects for Solving Digital Society Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming concepts and logical reasoning skills
context.additional_context: Project-based course applying computer science to solve social problems

learning_goals: Students can analyze real-world social issues and design computing solutions to address them.
Students can collaborate in a problem-based learning (PBL) environment to implement web-based prototypes.
Students can establish and share criteria for evaluating the social impact of developed solutions.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
